archetype_name: Family Light & Fresh: Japanese and Vietnamese Weeknights
name: Ponzu Tilapia with Bok Choy Veg over Jasmine Rice
description: Light, citrusy pan-seared tilapia glazed with ponzu and quick-sautéed veggies over fluffy jasmine rice. Mild, fresh, and weeknight-fast.
prep_steps: Rinse 1.5 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Measure 2.25 cups water for the rice.
Pat dry 4 tilapia fillets; season both sides with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Mix sauce: 1/3 cup ponzu sauce, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tbsp honey, and juice of 1/2 lime.
Slice 2 bok choy (separate stems and leaves), thinly slice 2 carrots, and 1 bell pepper.
Mince 3 cloves garlic; slice 3 spring onion (whites and greens separated).
Cut remaining 1/2 lime into wedges for serving.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Combine rinsed jasmine rice and measured water in a pot; bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest covered 5 minutes.
Heat a large nonstick pan over medium with 1 tbsp canola oil.
Sear tilapia 2–3 minutes per side until opaque and flakes easily.
Pour the ponzu-honey mixture into the pan; simmer 30–60 seconds, spooning over fish to glaze. Transfer fish to a plate; keep warm.
In the same pan, add 1 tbsp canola oil. Sauté spring onion whites and minced garlic 30 seconds.
Add carrot and bell pepper; cook 2 minutes, stirring.
Add bok choy stems, a splash of water, and a pinch of salt; cook 2 minutes to soften. Stir in bok choy leaves; cook 30–60 seconds until just wilted.
Fluff rice. Plate rice, top with sautéed vegetables, then the glazed tilapia. Spoon any remaining pan sauce over.
Garnish with spring onion greens and lime wedges.
